thread.title: Jerome Champagne enters FIFA presidential election contest
thread.title_full: Jerome Champagne enters FIFA presidential election contest

title: Jerome Champagne enters FIFA presidential election contest
text:
Former FIFA official Jerome Champagne files entry papers in election to succeed Blatter 
By GRAHAM DUNBAR - AP Sports Writer Published: 10/23/15 2:30 am EDT - Updated: 10/23/15 2:30 am EDT 
GENEVA â€” Jerome Champagne says he has filed papers to enter the FIFA presidential election. 
Champagne, the former FIFA international relations director, told The Associated Press on Friday: "I sent my application letter and eight nomination letters to FIFA on Monday night." 
The French former diplomat's manifesto plans to modernize how FIFA is run, cut European places at FIFA and the World Cup, plus trial use of video review to help referees. 
Champagne did not get nominated for the previous election, won in May by his ally Sepp Blatter . 
He now joins Michel Platini , Prince Ali bin al-Hussein and David Nakhid in meeting Monday's deadline to enter the Feb. 26 poll. More contenders are expected. 
Platini, who helped force Champagne's FIFA exit in 2010, is unlikely to be accepted as a candidate. FILE - In this May 29, 2014, file photo, French former FIFA executive Jerome Champagne gestures during an interview with The Associated Press in Paris. Champagne, a former French diplomat and onetime FIFA international relations director, will announce his entry into the contest to succeed Sepp Blatter in an election scheduled Feb. 26. The deadline for contenders to apply is Monday Oct. 26, 2015. (AP Photo/Francois Mori, File)
